summary: We tested structured prefix slot factorization (UUID + augmentation slots + base-task slots) to encourage more shared task representations across augmentations. Under our explored settings, gains were not reliable and metrics were mostly flat-to-worse versus baseline.
compute_caveat: Many runs were compute-limited (often short-to-mid length, e.g. ~30k-50k steps), so this should be interpreted as directional rather than definitive.
recommended_next_step: If revisiting, run longer controlled sweeps with fixed evaluation protocol, report per-ablation fingerprints, and test whether improvements emerge only after longer finetune horizons.
